archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The Hiram P. Teed Correspondence collection consists of correspondence between Pvt. Hiram P. Teed and his wife, Elizabeth. Altogether, there are seven letters--six from Teed, one from Elizabeth--from 1862-1863.
did.origination: Teed, Hiram P., Co. A, 144 Regiment, New York Infantry; Teed, Elizabeth Wakeman

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Hiram P. Teed Correspondence must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Hiram P. Teed Correspondence, Ms2011-101, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Special Collections purchased the Hiram P. Teed Correspondence in September 2011.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Hiram P. Teed Correspondence was completed in October 2011.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Hiram P. Teed was born about 1834 in New York and married Elizabeth Wakeman (b. abt. 1831). He enlisted with the 144th Regiment, New York Infantry during the Civil War and fought in several battles including Fort Wagner and Honey Hill. After the war, Teed returned to New York. In 1876 he and his wife had a daughter, Isa (Isabelle?). By 1880, they had moved to Pennsylvania and Teed worked as a sewing machine dealer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of six letters from Pvt. Hiram P. Teed, Co. A, 144th New York Volunteers, and one letter from his wife, Elizabeth. The letters (1862-1863) detail camp movement and business, home affairs, and Teed's romantic frustrations at the separation from his wife.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically. The two letters that are undated appear at the front of the collection.
